channel.title: John Graham | Portfolio
channel.description: A portfolio and blog showcasing web development projects and technical articles.

item.title: Building AI-Author: My Journey Creating an Interactive Story Generator
item.description: When I set out to build AI-Author, I had a clear vision - create a platform where users could generate personalized stories with the help of AI.

item.title: Building a Specialized Inventory Management System for Non-Profits
item.description: When I first met with the Community Aid Center (CAC), they described a common challenge faced by many non-profits - tracking donated inventory effectively with limited resources.

item.title: Creating an Internal Merchandise Store: Simplifying Company Swag Distribution
item.description: Company merchandise is more than just branded swagâ€”it's a tangible expression of company culture and team unity.

item.title: Developing a Job Application Tracker for The Joshua Center
item.description: When The Joshua Center approached me about building a job application tracking system, I saw an opportunity to create something that would genuinely help both the organization and the people they serve.

item.title: DoorDash Addiction
item.description: I'll admit it upfront - I've been a DoorDash addict. For nearly three years, I ordered food delivery 4-5 times weekly, watching my savings dwindle while my waistline expanded. What started as an occasional convenience during busy workweeks gradually morphed into a default behavior.

item.title: Tool Overanalyzer
item.description: When deciding on a programming language for your next project, Go and Rust frequently emerge as modern contenders with enthusiastic communities. Having worked with both in professional settings for web and game development, I'd like to share an honest, experience-based comparison of these languages across these different domains.

item.title: Web Dev Tools I Use
item.description: As a web developer, your choice of tools can dramatically impact your productivity, code quality, and overall enjoyment of the development process. Over the years, I've experimented with countless frameworks, libraries, and tools before settling on my current tech stack.
